description: A Scottish variant of assoil, from Scottish Middle English assolyhe, assol»ùe, retaining the -le- or -li- sounds of Anglo-Norman as(s)oilier and Old French as(s)oille which were dropped in modern English spoken in England.

verbs.description: assoilzie (third-person singular simple present assoilzies, present participle assoilzieing or assoilzying, simple past and past participle assoilzied)

entries.meaning: (archaic) To absolve or release (someone) from blame or sin; to forgive, to pardon.
(law) Followed by from or of: to acquit (someone) from a criminal charge; to find (someone) not guilty; to clear.
